intro: Hiraea multiflora, commonly known as the many-flowered hiraea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to parts of Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in woodland and grassland habitats. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It produces small, elliptical leaves that are opposite along the stems. Hiraea multiflora is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
